GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VII-B, LINE 5B: STATEMENTS REGARDING ACTIVITIES
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: THE WILLIAM AND FLORA HEWLETT FOUNDATION (THE "FOUNDATION") FILED A FORM 4720, REPORTING A TAXABLE EXPENDITURE AND REQUESTING ABATEMENT OF THE EXCISE TAX UNDER SECTION 4945(A)(1) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, WITH RESPECT TO ONE GRANT OF $100,000 AWARDED TO A SECTION 501(C)(3) PRIVATE OPERATING FOUNDATION AT THE END OF 2014. IN REVIEWING ITS GRANT FILES IN PREPARATION FOR FILING ITS FORM 990-PF FOR 2014, THE FOUNDATION DISCOVERED THAT THE INITIAL GRANT AGREEMENT FOR THIS GRANT DID NOT CONTAIN ALL OF THE CONTRACTUAL PROVISIONS ENUMERATED IN SECTION 53.4945-5(B)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE - SPECIFICALLY, AND PRINCIPALLY, IT DID NOT PROHIBIT THE GRANTEE FROM UTILIZING GRANT FUNDS TO CONDUCT LOBBYING OR TO MAKE GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS OR OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT DO NOT COMPLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF SECTIONS 4945(D)(3) AND (D)(4) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IN ALL OTHER RESPECTS, THE FOUNDATION'S ACTIONS WERE LARGELY CONSISTENT AND COMPLIANT WITH THE PROCEDURES FOR APPROVAL AND OVERSIGHT OF AN EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY GRANT). AS A RESULT, THE FOUNDATION DETERMINED THAT IT HAD NOT INITIALLY COMPLIED WITH THE TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS OF EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY, NOTWITHSTANDING THE FACT THAT THE GRANTEE'S STATUS AS A PRIVATE OPERATING FOUNDATION EFFECTIVELY ENSURED THAT NO GRANT FUNDS WOULD BE USED FOR SUCH PURPOSES. THE FOUNDATION IMMEDIATELY CONDUCTED A REVIEW OF THE GRANT AND DETERMINED THAT ITS INADVERTENT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS WAS DUE TO REASONABLE CAUSE AND NOT WILLFUL NEGLECT. IT THEN CONFIRMED WITH THE GRANTEE THAT ALL FUNDS HAD IN FACT BEEN USED IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY AND ENTERED INTO A REVISED GRANT AGREEMENT WITH THE GRANTEE, WHICH WAS MADE APPLICABLE TO THE GRANT FROM ITS INCEPTION, THAT IS FULLY COMPLIANT WITH THE TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 53.4945-5(B)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FOUNDATION ALSO IMPLEMENTED PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THIS TYPE OF SITUATION WOULD NOT OCCUR AGAIN.

GeneralExplanationGrp.IdentifierTxt: PART IX: SUMMARY OF DIRECT CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES
GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART IX: SUMMARY OF DIRECT CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: (1) A DEEPER LEARNING TOOLKIT FOR SCHOOL TRANSFORMATION THE FOUNDATION HIRED A CONSULTANT TO PARTNER WITH EXPERTS TO BUILD A DEEPER LEARNING TOOLKIT THAT SCHOOL PRINCIPALS AND OTHER EDUCATORS CAN USE TO TRANSFORM THEIR SCHOOLS INTO DEEPER LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS. THE TOOLS DEVELOPED WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR ANY SCHOOL TO USE IN A SELF-FACILITATED MODEL. $872,500 (2) MARKET ENTRY STRATEGY FOR FAMILY PLANNING IN NIGER THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTED DEVELOPING A MARKET ENTRY STRATEGY FOR FAMILY PLANNING IN NIGER BASED ON QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH AND AN ASSESSMENT OF THE POLICY ENVIRONMENT FOR FAMILY PLANNING SERVICE DELIVERY. STRATEGY, RESEARCH FINDINGS AND RAW DATA ARE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE AND ACTIVELY DISSEMINATED AMONG THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH, DONORS AND SERVICE DELIVERY ORGANIZATIONS WORKING IN NIGER TO SUPPORT THE DESIGN OF EFFECTIVE AND RESPONSIVE FAMILY PLANNING PROGRAMS. $593,000 (3) INNOVATION WITHIN GOVERNMENT: DEMYSTIFYING THE PROCESS THE FOUNDATION HIRED A CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP A STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS PLAN AND ACCOMPANYING COMMUNICATIONS MATERIALS FOR THE INTERNATIONAL OPEN GOVERNMENT COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT ALONG WITH GOVERNMENT STAKEHOLDERS ASSISTS IN WIDE DISSEMINATION AND SHARING OF THESE MATERIALS AMONG ORGANIZATIONS, RESEARCHERS & OTHER OPEN GOVERNMENT PARTICIPANTS, TOWARDS A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF INNOVATION PROCESSES WITHIN GOVERNMENT. $450,000 (4) DEEPER LEARNING PUBLIC COMMUNICATIONS THE FOUNDATION HIRED A CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED COMMUNICATIONS INITIATIVE TO ADVANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING OF DEEPER LEARNING WORKING WITH HEWLETT'S GRANTEES AND OTHER EDUCATION CHAMPIONS. $333,000 (5) OTHER DIRECT CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES $4,911,783 TOTAL DIRECT CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES: $7,157,283

THE WILLIAM AND FLORA HEWLETT FOUNDATION (THE "FOUNDATION") MAKES GRANTS TO NONPROFIT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS CLASSIFIED AS 501(C)(3) PUBLIC CHARITIES BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES. THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT MAKE GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS. IT DOES NOT MAKE GRANTS FOR POLITICAL PURPOSES OR TO SUPPORT CANDIDATES FOR POLITICAL OFFICE, OR TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION. THE FOUNDATION MAKES GRANTS IN FIVE CORE PROGRAM AREAS (EACH, A "PROGRAM"): EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENT, GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT AND POPULATION, PERFORMING ARTS, AND EFFECTIVE PHILANTHROPY. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION MAKES GRANTS TO SUPPORT DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN THE BAY AREA AND TO SUPPORT INITIATIVES TO ADVANCE THE FIELD OF CYBERSECURITY AND STRENGTHEN DEMOCRACY IN AMERICA. THE FOUNDATION'S GRANTS ARE AWARDED SOLELY FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES. THE FOUNDATION FUNDS ORGANIZATIONS WORKING IN THESE IDENTIFIED AREAS, BASED ON SPECIFIC GOALS AND STRATEGIES OUTLINED BY THE PROGRAMS. ALMOST ALL GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO ORGANIZATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE FOUNDATION. THE FOUNDATION DOES ACCEPT UNSOLICITED LETTERS OF INQUIRY FROM ORGANIZATIONS LOOKING FOR FUNDING IN LIMITED AREAS. ONLY ON VERY RARE OCCASIONS ARE GRANTS AWARDED IN RESPONSE TO THESE UNSOLICITED FUNDING INQUIRIES. THERE ARE NO DEADLINES FOR SUBMITTING A LETTER OF INQUIRY, YET NOT ALL PROGRAMS ACCEPT LETTERS OF INQUIRY AT ALL TIMES. THE FOUNDATION RECOMMENDS THAT ALL PROSPECTIVE APPLICANTS REFER TO THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE AT WWW.HEWLETT.ORG TO READ ABOUT THE FOUNDATION'S PROGRAMS, GOALS AND STRATEGIES, AND GEOGRAPHIC LIMITATIONS. IF A PROSPECTIVE APPLICANT'S OBJECTIVES FIT WITHIN THE GUIDELINES OF A PARTICULAR PROGRAM AND THE PROGRAM CURRENTLY ACCEPTS UNSOLICITED INQUIRIES, THE APPLICANT MUST SUBMIT A LETTER OF INQUIRY, WHICH CAN BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE FOR INITIAL REVIEW. AFTER THE APPLICANT'S LETTER OF INQUIRY IS RECEIVED AND REVIEWED, THE FOUNDATION MAY, AT ITS DISCRETION, INVITE THE APPLICANT TO PROCEED TO THE SECOND STEP AND SUBMIT A FULL PROPOSAL. FURTHER INFORMATION TO ASSIST APPLICANTS, FINANCIAL INFORMATION AND A COMPLETE SET OF FOUNDATION ANNUAL REPORTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE.
